poem:
### The World's Tether

In whispered tones  
the service hums,  
frequencies of truth  
stretch thin against  
the drumbeat of power.  
  
A tether,  
frayed by wallets  
fed by armor-clad pockets—  
may voices not cave  
to the nation's  
heavy syllables.
